page.title: 10Wolverhampton Radio
page.content: Beacon Radio was founded in 1976 so it has been broadcasting for nine years. About 220 records a day are played.Each day there are about 7 quizzes.There are 30 broadcasters working at Beacon Radio.The name comes from one of their transmission stations at Sedgeley Beacon. It covers Wolverhampton,Walsall,Dudley, Sandwell and much of Shropshire and Staffordshire.20 hours a day is spent playing popular music.The difference between Radio 1 and Beacon Radio is that Radio 1 is a BBC station and Beacon is an independent station.Beacon is called 303 because it broadcasts on medium wave 303 metres. It serves the community by providing local news and information on weather and traffic problems.It also has interviews with local people.
